definition: advantages a company offers in addition to the salary. SYN perks INF.
a number of benefits that are offered together.
money paid to sb to help them, either on a regular basis or for a particular purpose (food/fuel allowance).
linked to how well sb does in their job.
extra money paid to sb, often annually or as a reward for sth. scheme an official plan.
money paid regularly by a company to help sb when they retire (also government pension or personal/private pension).
a period when a woman temporarily leaves her job to have a baby.
a short period off work allowed to a new father.
the money sb spends while working that the employer pays back to them later (travel/travelling expenses).
a thing sb has a right to (often expressed as an amount sb has a right to receive). be entitled to sth v.

comprehensive including everything or almost everything (comprehensive car/travel/health insurance). healthcare the service of providing medical care (also childcare = the care and supervision of small children). provision the act of providing sth (here, private health insurance).
If sth is subsidized, it is partly paid for by an organization in order to make it cheaper for the people who use it. canteen a place where food is served in a company or school.
the advantages and disadvantages/drawbacks.
expected to explain all your actions to sb if asked (if you are not accountable to anyone you are your own boss).
a clear understanding of what sth is like.
producing a large amount of money.
only; not involving sb/sth else (be solely responsible for sth).
try to manage and balance different jobs and activities in order to fit them successfully into your life.
persian: همزمان چند کار را مدیریت کردن، موازنه کردن

definition: promise that sth will happen. guarantee N.
more than has been experienced or mentioned before. SYNS extra, further.
experience sth, especially problems or opposition.
FML affect or use up too much of sb's time, rights, personal life, etc.
persian: تجاوز کردن به (زمان، حقوق و غیره)

definition: A degree of sth is a certain level or amount of sth, and it is commonly used in certain expressions or patterns.
example: It requires a degree of skill.

definition: a goal shared by two or more people.
the feeling of confidence and enthusiasm that a person or group has at a particular time (boost morale = improve morale).
help sth to develop. SYNS encourage sth, promote sth.
the desire among a group to work together and help each other.
the act of working with others to produce sth.
used to describe a feeling that two people have for each other equally (mutual respect/trust).
giving personal satisfaction. SYN rewarding.
think that sb/sth is important.
persian: قدر قائل شدن، ارزش قائل شدن برای

definition: collect money, ideas, etc. from different people so it or they can be used by all of them (pool resources).
persian: جمع‌آوری و به اشتراک گذاشتن (منابع، ایده‌ها)

definition: be accepted in a situation by the others in a group.
causing problems, and making it hard to continue with sth. disrupt sth v.
make sb/sth gradually weaker or less effective (undermine sb's confidence/authority).
stop sth from happening or developing (stifle creativity).
the ability to think of new ideas and make them successful.
the ability to take decisions and act alone (use your initiative).
likely to happen soon.
example: Warburg takeover imminent.

definition: having a particular position in the past (former president/boss).
organize and begin sth (mount a challenge/campaign).
involving two or more people (joint account/venture). jointly ADV.
an offer to pay a particular price for sth (make a bid for sth). bid v.
help. SYN support. back sb/sth v.
refuse to accept sth. SYN turn sth down. rejection N.
a person who owns shares in a business or company.
a portion of a company's profits that is given to shareholders.
succeed in achieving or winning sth (clinch a deal/victory).
example: Cavendish could clinch the deal.

definition: start a process or series of events.
two companies agree to join and form a single company.
one company buys the shares of another public company.
one company buys another company which cannot offer its shares for sale to the public.
The companies may or may not agree to the deal. If they agree, it is a friendly takeover.
If they do not agree, it is a hostile takeover.
INF go out of business. SYN go bankrupt.
example: The company may go under.

definition: stop running a business and close it completely.
example: The board may have to wind up the company.

definition: leave an important job.
example: The chairman had to step down.

definition: spend less money because there will be less available.
example: We will all have to tighten our belts.

definition: take a particular course of action.
example: The company doesn't want to go down that particular road.
persian: آن مسیر خاص را دنبال کردن

word: wriggle out of sth / doing sth
definition: INF, DISAPPROVING avoid doing sth that you should do.
example: They are trying to wriggle out of their obligation to customers.
persian: شانه خالی کردن از زیر چیزی

definition: DISAPPROVING persuade or tempt sb to do sth by offering them a reward. SYN entice sb.
example: The company is trying to lure passengers away from its rivals.

definition: not accept a bad situation without a fight or protest.
example: You can be sure that BA won't take this situation lying down.

definition: affect the result of sth in one way rather than another.
example: The city's transport links could tip the balance in their favour.
persian: تعادل را بر هم زدن، نتیجه را تغییر دادن

definition: increase sth and make it stronger (fuel fears/inflation).
example: The situation is fuelling fears that prices could rise again.

definition: the situation becomes clearer and less disturbed.
example: Wait until the dust settles.
persian: آرام شدن اوضاع، فرو نشستن گرد و غبار

definition: likely to happen.
example: A takeover bid is on the cards.

definition: rise suddenly and quickly. SYN rocket.
example: Share prices have soared.

definition: a large and sudden increase in the amount or value of sth. surge v.
example: The market is now expecting a surge in the value of the euro.

definition: an improvement or increase. OPP loss.
example: The dollar made significant gains.

definition: INF a sudden or significant increase in the level or amount of sth. OPP cut.
example: Another hike in the rate is possible.

definition: become stronger. OPP weaken.
example: The yen will strengthen.

definition: increase in value after a period when it has fallen. SYN recover / bounce back.
example: The pound rallied later in the day.

definition: confident, successful, and staying at a high level. SYN healthy.
example: The market is still buoyant.

definition: buy sth quickly, usually while it is cheap or available.
example: The advice is to snap up the shares while you can.

definition: fall suddenly and quickly. SYN plunge.
example: The value may plummet even more.
persian: سقوط کردن، به شدت کاهش یافتن

definition: fall by a large amount. slump N (economic slump OPP economic boom).
example: The price has slumped to its lowest level.

definition: reduce sth by a large amount.
example: The Federal Reserve has slashed the discount rate.

definition: remove sth from sth, quickly and completely.
example: The recession has wiped billions off the stock markets round the world.
persian: حذف کردن، از بین بردن (مقدار پول)

definition: a state of great confusion.
example: The market is still in turmoil.

definition: likely to change suddenly. volatility N.
example: The market remains volatile.

definition: a lot of sudden change (also a bumpy ride INF). turbulent ADJ.
example: There is likely to be short-term turbulence in the market.

definition: a person who buys land, shares, etc. in order to make a profit. invest v.
saying two different and opposing things. SYN conflicting. contradiction N. contradict sb/sth v.
example: Investors may be given contradictory advice.

definition: PL company shares which do not pay a fixed rate of interest.
support or form the basis of sth.
example: Good global growth which will underpin corporate profit.

definition: connected with a large business company. corporation N.
the responsibility of having to pay back a lot of money.
example: Few significant debt burdens.

definition: the total profit or income you get from a business or investment.
example: Current yields may be low.

definition: (in finance) An underlying number or situation shows what the true amount or level of sth is.
example: The underlying outlook is healthy.

definition: the probable future for sth.
(in finance) a temporary and fragile situation caused by a rapid increase in sth (the bubble will burst = the situation will end, and people will lose money).
example: A huge credit bubble.

definition: If sth dries up, there is gradually less and less of it.
example: Bank lending will dry up.

definition: cause sth to happen.
example: Could trigger more selling.

definition: suffering from strain.
example: Put markets under pressure.

definition: PL the money a person or business has to spend regularly. OPP income.
example: Keep a record of your outgoings.

definition: a plastic card used for taking money directly from your bank account.
not have information about what is happening or where sth/sb is. OPP keep track of sth/sb.
example: Lose track of what you spend.
persian: رد چیزی را گم کردن، بی‌اطلاع بودن

definition: If you are in credit, there is money in your account. OPP overdrawn / in the red INF.
example: Keep your account in credit all the time.

definition: increase gradually in size. SYN build up/accumulate.
example: Allow debts to mount up.

definition: a piece of business between people.
example: Check all the transactions in your bank statements.

definition: a record of the money paid into and out of a bank account.
careful about spending money. OPP extravagant.
waste sth, especially money or time, in a careless way.
example: Squander large sums of money.

definition: an amount of money.
gives immediate access to your money, but pays little interest.
pays more interest but without such quick access.
plan how much to spend and what to spend it on (a budget is the amount of money available to spend, with a plan for spending it).
use numbers to find a total number, amount, or distance. SYN work sth out. calculation N.
example: Calculate the total amount of money coming in.

definition: for each (used to express the cost or amount of sth for each person, period of time, etc.).
take one number from another to calculate the difference. SYN take sth away from sth.
example: Subtract the expenses from the income.

definition: A surplus is more of something than is necessary. If it is money, the opposite is a deficit.
example: If there's a surplus, don't spend it.

definition: an amount of money available for a particular purpose.
example: Emergency fund.

definition: sth that may or may not happen (contingency plans/a contingency fund).
example: Keep for contingencies.

definition: the difference between what you have and what you need.
example: If there is a shortfall, then you must take action.

definition: reduce the amount of money, time, goods, etc. that you use. SYN make cutbacks.
example: Consider where you can economize.

definition: give money to sb to help them pay for sth. subsidy N.
example: Don't expect anyone else to subsidize you.

definition: rescue sb from a difficult situation, often with money.
write sth quickly.
example: Jot down a list of jobs to do.

definition: a particular way in which sth is organized or done (on a day-to-day basis, on a daily/weekly/regular basis).
example: On a daily basis.

definition: put tasks, problems, etc. in order of importance and do the most important first. priority N (high/low/top priority).
example: Do you prioritize ruthlessly.

definition: in a determined and firm way.
example: You need to be ruthless.

definition: succeed in doing or completing sth. SYN achieve sth.
example: Accomplish your daily list.
persian: به انجام رساندن، موفق شدن در

definition: continue doing sth despite difficulties.
example: Do you stick to your priorities.

definition: expect sth will happen and prepare for it. anticipation N.
example: Try to anticipate so that you can schedule your tasks better.

definition: arrange for sth to happen at a particular time. schedule N.
example: Schedule your tasks better.

definition: give part of your work to sb, especially sb in a lower position.
example: Do you delegate responsibilities.

definition: strict and severe.
example: Set yourself rigorous time limits.

definition: means 'it doesn't matter what (when, etc.)' or 'it isn't important what (when, etc.)'.
example: No matter what happens, don't panic.
persian: مهم نیست چه چیزی، هر آنچه که

definition: given so many things that you cannot deal with them. SYNS overwhelmed, swamped.
example: Workers say they are inundated with a never-ending stream of emails.
persian: غرق در چیزی، لبریز از چیزی

definition: seeming to last for ever. SYN interminable.
example: A never-ending stream of emails.

definition: INF too anxious and tired to be able to relax.
example: Are stressed out by the pressure.
persian: تحت فشار عصبی، خسته و مضطرب

definition: quickly; without delay. prompt ADJ.
example: Respond to them promptly.

definition: not producing good results. OPP productive.
example: Leaving them frustrated and unproductive.

definition: badly affected by sth (also severely/badly hit).
example: Females feel particularly hard-hit by the deluge.

definition: be/become impossible to control. OPP be under control.
example: Email is got out of hand.

definition: stop speaking or doing sth for a time.
example: When you break off from what you are doing.

definition: a linked series of thoughts in your head at one time.
example: You lose your train of thought.

definition: keep sth, especially money or time, for a purpose.
example: Set aside two or three specific email-reading times.

definition: a fast-spreading disease which often results in death; in the title it is something that causes irritation.
example: Email stress: the new office workers' plague.

definition: a small river, but here it means a continuous flow of things.
example: A never-ending stream of emails.

definition: a flood or heavy rain, but in the text it means a great quantity of something arriving at the same time.
example: Hard-hit by the deluge.

definition: a failure to reach an agreement or settle an argument (be unable to break the deadlock).
example: Talks between Royal Mail bosses and the CWU union have again ended in deadlock.

definition: a system of voting in which votes are made in secret (ballot (v)).
example: Following the support of its members in the national ballot.

definition: a disagreement, often official, between people or groups (a pay/industrial dispute, settle a dispute).
example: It is not just a pay dispute.

definition: prevent sth from continuing.
example: An attempt to halt the closure of 2,500 post offices.

definition: a situation in which a school, factory, etc. is permanently shut.
example: The closure of 2,500 post offices.

definition: the process of selling an industry so it is no longer owned by the government. OPP nationalization. privatize sth v.
example: Further privatization of services.

definition: If sth is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful (there's a lot at stake / the stakes are high).
example: There is a great deal at stake.

definition: a thing that happened in the past which is seen as a rule or example to be followed by others in a similar situation.
example: It could set a precedent for other groups.

definition: likely to do sth or tending to do sth. inclination N.
example: Who may feel more inclined to step up their own claims.

definition: increase the amount of an activity in order to achieve sth.
example: Step up their own claims for higher wage settlements.

definition: Set is used with many nouns, often meaning to fix something for others to copy, e.g. set an example, set a standard, set a record, set a precedent. It can also mean to decide on something, as in set a date/limit.
example: Set a date for strikes.

definition: get involved in a situation in order to help. intervention N.
example: Intervene at once to resolve the problem.

definition: FML find an acceptable solution to a problem. resolution N.
example: Intervene to resolve the problem.
persian: حل و فصل کردن، رفع کردن

definition: (of a person or policy) creating or controlling a situation by making things happen, rather than waiting for things to happen.
example: This would be proactive.

definition: do sth to solve a problem.
example: A positive way to tackle the problem.
persian: رسیدگی کردن به یک مشکل، حل کردن

definition: make sth more serious than it is.
example: Is there a risk of blowing it up out of all proportion?

definition: deal with a problem successfully (if sth sorts itself out, the problem is resolved without the need for action from anyone).
example: See if the staff can sort it out themselves.

definition: make sb else deal with sth that you should deal with.
example: This could be interpreted as passing the buck.
persian: مسئولیت را به گردن دیگری انداختن

definition: get involved in a situation in a way that annoys others. interference N.
example: The staff may not want you to interfere.

definition: sensible; showing good judgement. wisdom N. SYN prudent. prudence N.
example: It could be a wise thing to do.

definition: FML delay doing sth until later, often because you don't want to do it. procrastination N.
example: Would you just be procrastinating?
persian: امروز و فردا کردن، به تعویق انداختن

word: bury your head in the sand
definition: pretend a difficult situation doesn't exist.
example: Would you bury your head in the sand?
persian: نادیده گرفتن مشکل، سر در برف فرو بردن

definition: a thing you particularly dislike or find annoying.
example: It's one of my pet hates.
persian: چیزی که به شدت آزاردهنده است، مورد تنفر شخصی

definition: a situation in which a machine doesn't work because sth is stuck in one position (a paper jam). jam v (the photocopier keeps jamming).
example: Create a paper jam in the photocopier.
persian: گیر کردن، انسداد (مثلاً کاغذ در دستگاه)

definition: make a situation better after a mistake has been made.
example: Leave others to put it right.

definition: not in a place, e.g. because of illness. absence N.
example: Are always absent when the work piles up.

definition: become larger in quantity or amount. SYN accumulate.
example: When the work piles up.
persian: تلنبار شدن، روی هم جمع شدن

definition: very busy.
example: Things are really hectic.

definition: not do sth, or not give enough attention to sth. neglect N.
example: Neglect their own work.

definition: INF become involved in sth that does not concern you.
example: Poke their noses into other people's business.

definition: not do sth that people expect you to do. SYN neglect to do sth.
example: Fail to provide handover instructions.

definition: the act of making sb else responsible for sth. hand sth over (to sb) v.
example: Provide handover instructions.

definition: sing a tune with your lips closed.
example: Constantly hum.
persian: زمزمه کردن، زیر لب آواز خواندن

definition: laugh in a silly way when you're embarrassed, amused, or nervous.
example: Giggle uncontrollably.

definition: take a quick, noisy breath in through your nose, e.g. when you have a cold.
example: Constantly sniff.

definition: angry or violent behaviour by one driver towards another driver.
example: The road rage thing was all sparked by a trivial incident.

definition: cause sth to start or develop suddenly.
example: All sparked by a trivial incident.
persian: باعث شروع شدن چیزی شدن، جرقه‌ای زدن

definition: sth that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant.
example: A trivial incident.

definition: make sb very angry, crazy, etc.
example: It was driving me mad.

definition: INF encourage sb to do sth, especially sth they should not do.
example: My passenger Phil egged me on to have a word with him.
persian: تحریک کردن کسی به کار بد

definition: used to suggest that the way one event leads to another is so obvious that it does not need to be stated.
example: One thing led to another and I found myself the owner of a new car.
persian: یک چیز به چیز دیگری منجر می‌شود (تسلسل وقایع)

definition: do sth harmful to sb because they harmed you first. retaliation N.
example: He retaliated and kicked mine.
persian: تلافی کردن، مقابله به مثل کردن

definition: say or do sth that you know will annoy sb so that they react angrily. SYN goad sb. provocation N.
example: Phil, who is easily provoked, joined in.

definition: react too strongly to sth, especially sth unpleasant.
example: I realize I overreacted.
persian: واکنش بیش از حد نشان دادن

definition: INF (of a situation) have sth as a main or basic part.
example: I think it all boils down to the fact that I haven't been well lately.
persian: خلاصه شدن در، علت اصلی بودن

definition: a number of connected events that happen one after the other. SYN sequence of events.
example: All I can say is that it was an unfortunate chain of events.

definition: make sb have a particular feeling or attitude. arouse (sb's) suspicion/curiosity.
example: What aroused the police's suspicions?

definition: a reason for doing sth.
example: Sims had a clear motive: revenge.

definition: the result of a situation or event (final outcome SYN end result).
example: What was the outcome of the discussion?

definition: FML force sb to do sth. coercion N.
example: We were eventually coerced into agreeing.
persian: مجبور کردن کسی به انجام کاری

definition: unintended and usually unwelcome results of an action or event. SYN consequences.
example: It was bound to have repercussions.

definition: make sb decide to do sth.
example: What prompted you to ring Nina?

definition: often used when you do not want to say why you have done sth.
example: No reason - just fancied a chat.

definition: a new product that is based on another that already exists.
example: We're considering various spin-offs.

definition: produce or create sth (generate income/profit/jobs).
example: That should generate more income.

definition: have an effect on sth, usually a good effect.
example: It's already made a big difference.

definition: If a law or regulation comes into effect, it begins to apply or be used.
example: Has the smoking ban come into effect?

definition: cause events to happen one after another in a series.
example: The flood had a knock-on effect on tourism.

definition: a negative or unpleasant one (OPP a beneficial effect).
